question.text: Mark the correct options stating the locations of the following centers.

options.text:
Pneumotaxic centre Apneustic centre Dorsal respiratory group Ventral respiratory group
Pons Pons Medulla Medulla

Pneumotaxic centre Apneustic centre Dorsal respiratory group Ventral respiratory group
Pons Medulla Pons Medulla

Pneumotaxic centre Apneustic centre Dorsal respiratory group Ventral respiratory group
Medulla Medulla Pons Pons

Pneumotaxic centre Apneustic centre Dorsal respiratory group Ventral respiratory group
Pons Pons Pons Medulla

solution.text: The dorsal and the ventral respiratory groups which are concerned with the processes of inhalation and exhalation are present in the medulla and the pneumatic and the apneustic centre which are antagonistic in function and affect the rate of respiration by sending signals to reduce or increase the inspiration are a part of the pons.
